data.diagnostic: This submission consists only of a very short, fragmented greeting and a name, lacking any substantial content, coherence, or grammatical complexity. It demonstrates minimal control over basic English vocabulary and structure.
strengths: The text successfully conveys the speaker's name ("my name is zehra").
Basic capitalization is present for the start of the sentence (though preceded by extraneous characters).
The attempt to communicate a basic personal fact is evident.
improvements: Develop basic sentence structures beyond simple identification.
Eliminate extraneous characters (like 'sddc') preceding the writing.
Practice forming complete, intelligible English sentences.
next_steps: Practice writing 3-5 complete sentences about daily routines or immediate surroundings.
Focus on correct English punctuation and standard letter casing.
Review foundational subject-verb agreement rules (e.g., 'I am' instead of implied missing verb).
